styleName.name: Article Title
styleName.description: Article title should be in title case

styleName.name: Article title: Capitalization (after colon, hyphen or Em dash)
styleName.description: Always capitalize the first and last words of a title, regardless of the part of speech. Capitalize after a marked break (such as a colon or em dash)

styleName.name: Abstract Title
styleName.description: Abstract title should be in Roman and remove end punc.

styleName.name: Article title: Affiliation designators
styleName.description: Superscript numbers, in sequence, comma separated with no space between comma and number if there is more than one affiliation, before the comma separating authors: Trevor Jones1*,

styleName.name: Ordinals
styleName.description: Spell out one to nine and also numbers at the beginning of the sentence (but will not change in units, weeks, days, and month).

styleName.name: Italicization
styleName.desciption: Do not italicse latin terms eg in vitro

styleName.name: Headings
styleName.desciption: Title case, not run in, black, larger font

styleName.name: Headings
styleName.desciption: Title case, not run in, black, larger font

styleName.name: Headings
styleName.desciption: Title case, not run in, black, larger font

styleName.xpath: //*[@class='jrnlArtTitle' or contains(@class,'jrnlHead1') or contains(@class,'jrnlHead2') or contains(@class,'jrnlHead3') or contains(@class,'jrnlHead4') or contains(@class,'jrnlHead5')]
styleName.name: Headings

styleName.description: Add dot at end of captions
Add dot at end of captions

styleName.name: Table Head
styleName.description: Table head should be in sentence case

styleName.name: PartLabel
styleName.description: Part label mention in figure caption must in uppercase
Add dot at end of captions
Add dot at end of captions
Set Ref Head content to be References

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: As part of our aim to expand readership, we ask all authors to provide a version of their abstract in their native language. If you are from a non-English speaking country, please could you provide a translation of your Abstract in your native language for us to provide as a supplementary file for your article?

styleName.name: Number Format
styleName.description: Use commas in 4 digit numbers and above e.g. 42,980. But if author changes it on proof stage we allow then to remove as long as consistent

styleName.name: Commas: Serial commas
styleName.description: Inserting serial comma if it is not present in the manuscript. If British English is to be retained serial comma need not be inserted but they can be retained if present.

styleName.name: Language
styleName.description: "Follow the author, as long as consistent.[In an article, if the author used US spelling in majority through out the article, but for one of the word if he has used UK spelling in majority, please change the UK spelling to US spelling for that particular word, as the whole article consistency is US.]".

styleName.name: Chi symbol
styleName.description: Chi-square - chi symbol should be used

styleName.name: Examples
styleName.description: e.g., i.e, etc. viz. cf. vs. to eg, etc, viz, cf, vs, and ie,

styleName.name: SI Units
styleName.description: Units should be separated by non-breaking space

styleName.name: addCompenent
styleName.function: Please provide the academic degrees for the author in the metadata form.

styleName.name: addCompenent
styleName.function: Please provide the ORCIDs for the author in the metadata form. If the authors do not have ORCIDs, please create new ORCIDs for them, as manuscripts cannot be published in this journal without ORCIDs.

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: For better indexing purposes, we recommend providing at least 5 keywords or key phrases. Terms more specific to the study should be used as keywords. In addition, a few MeSH terms should be used. Therefore, please add/revise the keywords accordingly here.

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: As per the journal guidelines, an abstract is mandatory for this article type. Please provide an abstract of <450 words [or 500 words, unstructured], with the following sections: Background, Objective, Methods, Results, Conclusions.

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: Please check the table's captions, content, and footnotes in detail.

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: Please check the figure's captions and content in detail.

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: The manuscript has multiple floats with similar labels and has been reordered. Kindly review and update the citations accordingly.
